course_title: Computational Modeling for Scientist & Engineers with Laboratory
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 12 / Seats Avail: 6Waitlist Total: 0 of 6
requirement_designation: Science, Nature and Technology with Lab
course_description: Computation is one of the pillars of modern science, in addition to experiment and theory. In this course, various computational modeling methods are introduced to study specific examples derived from physical, biological, chemical, and social systems. Four hours of lecture and one three-hour laboratory per week.
prerequisites: (MATH_OX 112 or MATH_OX 112Z) and (PHYS_OX 141 or PHYS_OX 151) or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
